result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Justin Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 15CF222 Counts 5 and 7
Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 15CF222 Counts 5 and 7

Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 15CF222 Counts 5 and 7

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations placed on payment plan

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

NO CONTACT WITH ANY OF THE VICTIMS IN THIS CASE UNLESS VICTIM CONSENTS.
Def is not to associate with drug users/dealers.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are consumed. Defendant is not to be present where illegal substances are possessed. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good Time
Granted Work and School Release
Defendant is to report to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blake Justin Mueller appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin.; Ct did receive FDS; Def is set up w/income assignment for $50.00 per week; Agent is Alyssa Morine; has not completed AODA and cognitive thinking and still owes restitution; Agent feels def is unmotivated; Def called AODA last week and left message; Ct finds not good faith in making payments and unmet treatment needs; Ct not extending at this time;
Def req to appear by phone, Judge ok'd
Notice fo Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Blake Justin Mueller in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA state has complied with victim rights, no agreement for sentencing, no corrections to PSI. Atty Perrine, no corrections to PSI.
DA, comments re read ins, Disagrees with DOC recommendation, rec 7 1/2 yrs prison, 3 1/2 IN 4 ES concurrent on felonies, 9 mo jail on each misd count concurrent to all. Comments on sentencing. Conditions ES rest $16106.07, AODA, no MAS-not present, NC with victims, maint full time employ/school or combo, cog, couns, cc  including $785.12 to APD. 
Atty Perrine comments on sentencing, asks court to follow DOC recommendations. Def comments. Ct questions/comments.
On each felony count WI DOC 4 yrs 2yrs IN 2yrs ES, imposed and stayed Ct1,5,7 concurrent to each other. Is El, is El, probation for 3yrs. NC with victims unless victim consents, maint full time empl, AODA, no MAS, no para, not present where consumed, not present illegal sub possessed, not to assoc drug user/dealer, cogn, couns, restitution summary, cc $554.40 on each. 
Mids Crim Damage 60 days jail, Obstructing 270 days jail, Good time on each, work release and school release, CTS 2 days. 7 days report to ACJ to set up time to begin serving and DNA. Begin serving 10/16 9am. Crim Damage $475.65, obstruct $465.15 plus costs $785.12. Bail applied, pay through COC, no gun no vote. DNA on each count.
Notice of Requirements and Penalties under 941.29 and 941.291

Defendant Blake Justin Mueller in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly McKnight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA agreement, in 15CF222 def plea to Ct1,4,5,7,11  all others DRI moves to dismiss 16CF154 as part of agreement def will stip to restitution $16106.07 and CC $785.12 for 15CF222 APD expenses. Joint req PSI parties free to argue. 
Def Plea NC to 5 counts, stipulates to costs and restitution. Cts 2,3,6,8-10, &12 DRI. 16CF154 DRI. 
Ct accepts pleas and finds def guilty. Ct orders PSI, def works AtoZ plumbing and heating $13 per hour, Income assignment ordered $50 per week. No gun notice
Bail continues based on good behavior, must go to DOC for PSI
